concept.title: Using Runtime Properties
concept.shortdesc: Runtime properties are properties that you define in a file local to the and call from within a pipeline. With runtime properties, you can define different sets of values for different s.

conbody.p: runtime propertiesoverviewYou can use runtime properties to define values for stage and pipeline properties. For example, you can define an error directory runtime property that points to different directories on a test machine and a production machine. Similarly, you might create test and production runtime properties for the origin and destination stages.

You can use runtime properties for any pipeline property that allows the use of the expression language. You can, for example, use runtime properties to represent batch sizes and timeouts, directories, URI, and advanced properties. You cannot use runtime properties to represent fields or constants.

To implement runtime properties, perform the following steps:
Define runtime properties.
Use an expression in the pipeline to call a runtime property.
